meanings.definition: To count less than the actual number.
meanings.sent1: She kept undercounting the candies in the jar.
meanings.sent2: The cashier was undercounting the money in the register.
meanings.sent3: The robot's undercounting of screws led to a wonky assembly.
meanings.sent4: His habit of undercounting his steps made his fitness tracker inaccurate.
meanings.sent5: Undercounting the ingredients in a recipe can ruin the dish.

meanings.definition: The act of counting fewer items than are actually present.
meanings.sent1: The undercounting of chairs in the room caused a seating shortage.
meanings.sent2: The undercounting of books in the library led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The undercounting of balloons at the party made the decorations look sparse.
meanings.sent4: The undercounting of votes in the election raised concerns about accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The undercounting of students in the class affected the teacher's planning.
